009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a 2D linear filter specified by an
017 * arbitrary 2D convolution kernel.
018 * It is based on {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalar},
019 * which take care of all data copying and filter mechanics.
020 * Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars.
021 * If the processed image has more than one component 
022 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
023 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
024 * To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)}
025 * method, for example.
026 */
027public class LinearFilter extends GenericFilterScalar {
028
029        private final float[][] H;                      // the kernel matrix, note H[y][x]!
030        private final int xc, yc;                       // 'hot spot' coordinates
031        
032        /**
033         * Constructor. Only the 2D filter kernel (see {@link Kernel2D}) needs to be specified.
034         * 
035         * @param kernel the 2D filter kernel
036         */
037        public LinearFilter(Kernel2D kernel) {
038                this.H = kernel.getH();
039                this.xc = kernel.getXc();
040                this.yc = kernel.getYc();
041        }
042
043        @Override
044        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
045                double sum = 0;
046                for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
047                        int vj = v + j - yc;
048                        for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
049                                int ui = u + i - xc;
050                                sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
051                        }
052                }
053                return (float)sum;
054//              return convolve(source, H, u, v, xc, yc);
055        }
056        
057//      public static float convolve(PixelSlice plane, float[][] H, int u, int v, int xc, int yc) {
058//              double sum = 0;
059//              for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
060//                      int vj = v + j - yc;
061//                      for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
062//                              int ui = u + i - xc;
063//                              sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
064//                      }
065//              }
066//              return (float)sum;
067//      }
068
069}
